page.title: 11FARMING IN DALWOOD.
page.content: A hundred years ago there were 37 farms in Dalwood. Now there are only sixteen.Some with thatch were burned down and some have become houses.Farm land has been joined to neighbouring farms and many hedges and trees have disappeared.Nowadays farms average 100-150 acres instead of 50 acres as in the past.Farms used to make cider.Now most are dairy farms with friesian cattle, some milkers and some for beef.Up until ten years ago milk was collected in churns but now it is pumped in to tankers.Once it took 4 men a day to make hay.Now one man with a silager can turn a field in an hour.There are two poultry farms.Sheep, pigs, goats and geese are also kept locally. On Thursdays farmers can sell their animals at Axminster Market.
